org.xchain.namespaces.jsl

Class AbstractTemplateCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.impl.ChainImpl
      • org.xchain.namespaces.jsl.AbstractTemplateCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Chain, Command, Locatable, Registerable

    public abstract class AbstractTemplateCommand
extends ChainImpl
implements Locatable, Registerable
    The base class for generated jsl template commands.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble, Jason Rose

      • getQName

        public javax.xml.namespace.QName getQName()
        Description copied from interface: Registerable
        If this command is registered, then the qname for this command is returned. Otherwise, the result is undefined.
        Specified by:
        getQName in interface Registerable
        Returns:
        the qname of this command, if it is registered. The result is undefined otherwise.

      • setSystemId

        public void setSystemId(java.lang.String systemId)
        Description copied from interface: Registerable
        Sets the registration system id for this command. This method should only be called by the XChain framework.
        Specified by:
        setSystemId in interface Registerable
        Parameters:
        systemId - the system id of the catalog where this command is registered.

      • getSystemId

        public java.lang.String getSystemId()
        Description copied from interface: Registerable
        If this command is registered, then the system id for the catalog it is registered in is returned. Otherwise, the result is undefined.
        Specified by:
        getSystemId in interface Registerable
        Returns:
        the system id of the catalog to which this command is registered. If the command is not registered, then the result is undefined.

      • executeChildren

        protected final boolean executeChildren(org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext context,
                      int[] childIndecies)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Calls the execute method of the children specified by childIndecies, passing it the supplied context. If the execute call completes without failing, then the command execution state for that child command is updated to EXECUTED.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
